author: @leoLorenzi
text: His pyQT version is outdated guys. Most of you are probably using pyQT v4.11.4.1. Some of his syntax is different. The updated syntax is:  1. Tooltip = QtGui.QAction.connect(extractAction, QtCore.SIGNAL('triggered()'), self.close_application) 2. Button = QtCore.QObject.connect(btn, QtCore.SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.close_application) Use where necessary (where "connect" is highlighted and python says no reference [in PyCharm])

text: another great tutorial. thanks!  relevant documentation. http://pyqt.sourceforge.net/Docs/PyQt4/qaction.html QAction.__init__ (self, QIcon icon, QString text, QObject parent) I get it that the self is not required in our code. I'm a little confused why we needed to reference 'self' in the code in place of 'QObject parent'  extractAction = QtGui.QAction(QtGui.QIcon('todachoppa.png'), 'Flee the Scene', self)  thoughts?

text: Hi Sentdex, thank you for your wonderful tubes In this tube I did the same code but unfortunately it haven't work  extractAction = QtGui.QAction(QtGui.QIcon('favicon.png'))  extractAction.triggered.connect(self.close_application)   self.toolBar = self.addToolBar("Extraction")   self.toolBar.addAction(extractAction)   and this message is appear  extractAction = QtGui.QAction(QtGui.QIcon('favicon.png')) TypeError: arguments did not match any overloaded call:   QAction(QObject): argument 1 has unexpected type 'QIcon'   QAction(str, QObject): argument 1 has unexpected type 'QIcon'   QAction(QIcon, str, QObject): not enough arguments   please help if possible thank you
